body_content.explanation: Cleistogamous plants have small, closed flowers, that pollinate (= create new plants) themselves, often in addition to larger, open flowers on the same plant. Cleistogamous flowers are small and always closed:
examples: A cleistogamous species consists of individuals that produce both chasmogamous (open) and cleistogamous (permanently closed) flowers.
The species is cleistogamous, as are many annual grasses in California.
